title: To The Great City!
summary:
Key ideas:
- The author reflects on their journey throughout medical residency and the support they received from their hospital and co-residents.
- The author distinguishes between a granfalloon (group of people brought together for a common purpose) and a karass (a group brought together by God for some purpose of His own).
- The author considers a letter they wrote to themselves four years ago, reminding themselves of their values and the importance of not allowing value drift.

Key learnings:
- The importance of support throughout the medical residency process.
- The difference between a granfalloon and a karass.
- The importance of reflecting on personal values and avoiding value drift.

Key questions:
- How can we distinguish between granfalloons and karasses in our own lives?
- How can we prevent value drift and maintain our core values over time?
